_dc:description: Persistent identifier for a trait descriptor used to identify the description of the measurement method. This could be the persistent URL to an external ontology where the trait term is declared.
Local identifier for a trait descriptor used to identify the description of the measurement method. This could be the persistent URL to an external ontology where the trait term is declared.
English name used to identify the trait measurement method.
_examples: stem rust susceptibility; powdery mildew susceptibility; plant height; ear density

_dc:description: Classification type for the trait descriptor.
_examples: agrobotanical; morphological; chemical; phenological; molecular biology; disease susceptibility/-resistance; tolerance (abiotic); utilization

_dc:description: Measurement scale used to score the measurement values.
_examples: absolute; interval; nominal; ordinal; ratio; relative

_dc:description: Reference to a standard Germplasm Descriptor. For example the UPOV descriptor or the Bioversity Crop Descriptor identifier.
Remarks related to the trait measurement method.
_examples: inflorescences after cutting; measured three days after heading date

_dc:description: The nature of the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
_examples: tail length, temperature, trap line length, survey area, trap type

_dc:description: A description of or reference to (publication, URI) the method or protocol used to determine the measurement, fact, characteristic, or assertion.
_examples: minimum convex polygon around burrow entrances (for a home range area), barometric altimeter
